page.title: 16Farndon Harbour near Newark
page.content: The harbour was started in 1966 but it was a gravel pit before. To help them they employ 3 men & 2 directors. The boats have had masts snapped under the bridge if they haven't assessed the proper height. Most of the boats come from Nottinghamshire, Lincolnshire, Leicestershire, Derbyshire, Yorkshire and as far away as Birmingham. The largest boat was owned by Mr. Mason. It was 160ft. long and 20ft. wide. There are about 150 boats in the harbour. The land around the harbour has many trees in it which are willow, alder and sycamore. There are lots of birds mainly water birds. There are many varieties of duck, Canada geese, grebe, swans and herons.
